original_title: Galle Literary Festival to bring more international visitors to Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Galle Literary Festival organizers expect an estimated 6,000 to 15,000 visitors in January 2024 as they focus on drawing a more international audience than previous years.

“We’ve got four primary demographics,” Giselle Harding, one of the organisers, told EconomyNext. “One being cultural tourists, those interested in literature and the arts. They tend to be 30-60 year-olds with a high net worth.”
Other demographics included students, authors, and media, Harding said. This year they were also hoping for more visitors from the Middle-East.
“GLF has advertised with the Times Literary Supplement (TLS) in London,” Harding said.
Foreign media have been invited to cover the event. “We will have journalists visiting from the South China Morning Post, as well as press from India, Sweden and the UK, she said.
The average tourist in Sri Lanka spends approximately 185-195 US dollars a day, Sri Lanka’s Tourism Development Authority said. The SLTDA has set a of target of 2.3 million tourists arriving in 2024.
The Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau said that there would be other festivals organized around the time of the Galle Literary Festival to offer something for everyone. (Colombo/Dec8/2023)
